definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
dried meat/private teacher's remuneration/withered/variant of 修[xiu1]
to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: This home was completely remodelled in 2008 with only the finest materials.
sentences.chinese: 这房屋在2008年完全翻修，采用最优秀的材料。

sentences.english: how all the spaces are allocated in the building, the new renovation in terms of the students groups.
sentences.chinese: 楼里所有空间如何分配和翻修，利于学生团队。

sentences.english: The workmen closed off the street for repairs.
sentences.chinese: 工人们将大街封锁进行翻修。

sentences.english: In addition, homeowners are seeing a value in retrofitting their homes to be more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 另外，私房屋主也看到了将房屋绿色翻修的节能价值。

sentences.english: There are shops, cafes, theaters, and people living in refurbished apartments above thriving businesses.
sentences.chinese: 人们住在欣欣向荣的店铺楼上被翻修一新的公寓中。

sentences.english: The most common revision procedures were extension of fascial incisions and opening new compartments.
sentences.chinese: 最常见的翻修术是延长筋膜切口和切开新的室间隔。

sentences.english: The technical aspects of the device explantation are discussed as well as issues pertinent to early failure.
sentences.chinese: 本文适当地讨论了早期失效后假体取出及翻修的技术。
我们需要全部重新翻修。

sentences.english: This involved retrofitting - installing lagging - in large numbers of public buildings.
sentences.chinese: 这包括对大量公共建筑进行翻修，并加装隔热层。

sentences.english: The surface of airport run-way of 50's has been confronted with rebuilding for these years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来，我国50年代修建的机场道面面临着翻修。

sentences.english: On the way back, they stopped at an old mosque which was being renovated.
sentences.chinese: 归途中，他们在一座正在翻修的清真寺前停下。

sentences.english: Soapy walked eastward through a street damaged by improvements.
sentences.chinese: 索丕向东穿过一条正在翻修的大街。

sentences.english: We can assist with building and designing new property , building maintenance and renovations.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以协助建设和设计新的物业，大厦维修和翻修。

sentences.english: They renovated the ceiling of the sistine chapel.
sentences.chinese: 他们翻修了西斯廷教堂的天花板。

sentences.english: He's not going to some special school to learn how to retread tires.
sentences.chinese: 他不应该去特殊学校学怎么翻修轮胎。

definition: to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
to revamp/a face-lift/to retread (a tire)/to refurbish (old clothes)/newly emerging
to extend (a building, an airport runway etc)
old and in a state of disrepair (idiom)/dilapidated
to carry out large scale construction
